thread.title: Mexico's 'cooking nun' takes TV shot to pay order's debts
thread.title_full: Mexico's 'cooking nun' takes TV shot to pay order's debts

title: Mexico's 'cooking nun' takes TV shot to pay order's debts
text: SUBSCRIBE FOLLOW US Â© 2015 Cox Media Group . By using this website, you accept the terms of our Visitor Agreement and Privacy Policy , and understand your options regarding Ad Choices . Learn about careers at Cox Media Group . Mexico's 'cooking nun' takes TV shot to pay order's debts Sixty-eight-year-old Florinda Ruiz Carapia, better known as "Hermana Flor," stirs a pan filled with rice in the kitchen of her convent, the Pontifical Palafoxiano Seminary, in Puebla, Mexico, Wednesday, Sept. 30, 2015. At the seminary in the central state of Puebla where she cooks three meals a day for seminarians, Hermana Flor runs a simple but sustainable and nutritious operation. "There is always chile in Mexico, and lots of it, and tomatoes, and onions," she said. "With that, I can make you a tasty dish." (AP Photo/Eduardo Verdugo) Most Read
